body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.14-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-799/folder/13176928/41237646/896383834 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ndk.2303+new184@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11 Home/Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: - Open ND and OD of same account in 2 devices. - In OD, Delay submission is set to 'Instantly' 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to Workflow page in ND and OD 3. ND, Enable 'Delay submission' 4. OD, Refresh the page 5. OD, Disable 'Delay submission' 6. ND, Refresh the page ## Expected Result: Workflow configuration between OD and ND should sync between the 2 apps, when user disables delay submission on OD, it should be disabled on ND also ## Actual Result: when user disables delay submission on OD, it is still enabled on ND ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a4e932bd-afe8-4a0b-9bdd-3c461e23f8a6 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Optimize BaseSelectionList component performance

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: AutoAssignerNewDotQuality
labels.description: Used to assign quality issues to engineers

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1757938701761199) ### Background The BaseSelectionList component is a critical UI component used throughout the Expensify app for rendering searchable lists of selectable items like reports, users or policies. Profiling shows severe slowdowns when rendering large datasets. The main culprit is excessive re-renders triggered by unstable object references and unnecessary state updates. In particular, flattenedSections variable performs heavy computations and is invoked 8 times, with each call averaging ~200ms. ### Problem When users open screens with SelectionList component containing large amount of options (e.g. Start chat), then frequent re-renders and repeated flattenedSections calculations occur, which creates performance bottlenecks and slows down screen access. ### Solution Implement stable array reference for selectedItems prop by using CONST.EMPTY_ARRAY to prevent unnecessary re-renders when no items are selected. This avoids creating a new array on each render, which previously caused React to detect a prop change even when the content was identical. Additionally, convert the itemHeights from state to ref, since it’s only used for layout calculations and doesn’t need to trigger re-renders. These changes preserve functionality while eliminating unnecessary render cycles, reducing BaseSelectionList render time on iOS (24k options, “Start chat” screen) from ~1.6s to ~200ms.

  • Upwork Job ID: 1967572861427133429

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.13-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @ikevin127 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1757726376186649) ## Action Performed: 1. Login with a new account, create a workspace and go to workspace settings > Company cards. 2. Click Add cards and proceed to add a Direct feed card by either using a real card from one of the bank options or click Other to add a faux BA via Plaid flow (only on staging server). 3. Once BA flow is completed, on the Statement close date RHP click Submit to complete BA addition. 4. On the Company cards page, click [+] Assign card and assign card to yourself > on Choose a transaction start date step keep default (From the beginning) > click Assign card. 5. Navigate to Reports page, click Expenses and verify that you see multiple expenses originating from the company card assigned in the previous step. 6. Navigate to workspace settings > Company cards and click Settings > Remove card feed and confirm Delete. 7. Navigate to Reports page. ## Expected Result: The app should not crash. ## Actual Result: The app crashes. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
